metadata.title: CVE-2016-8640 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A SQL injection vulnerability in pycsw all versions before 2.0.2, 1.10.5and 1.8.6 that leads to read and extract of any data from any table in thepycsw database that the database user has access to. Also on PostgreSQL (atleast) it is possible to perform updates/inserts/deletes and databasemodifications to any table the database user has access to.

criterions.comment: pycsw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
